Headline: |Real Estate | AI driven ROI | Prop Tech | Ex- Broker Network | Ex- Red Fm | Ex- Radio Mirchi | Ex- Standard chartered Bank
Comment:
Well said, Rishabh Mariwala 

While hiring the right candidates is crucial, it‚Äôs equally important that we have the right management and leadership in place to nurture, guide, and retain that talent. The best hires can only thrive under clear direction, a strong culture, and empowered leadership.

From an employer and top management perspective, great teams are built when:

Leadership sets the tone ‚Äì through clarity, accountability, and inspiration
Hiring aligns with purpose ‚Äì not just skills, but values and long-term fit
Managers are mentors ‚Äì creating environments where people can grow and perform
Culture is intentional ‚Äì because talent without alignment leads to friction

The real differentiator isn‚Äôt just who we hire, but how we lead them.

Thanks for bringing this conversation forward!

#Leadership #TalentStrategy #HiringRight #CultureDrivenGrowth #PeopleFirst

Headline: Technology Development | Process Optimization | Scale-Up | GTM
Comment:
Yes, early hires matter‚Äî 100%; but not always in the way we think. There‚Äôs an over-romanticism to early hiring that can become a blind spot later on.  I‚Äôve seen early teams idolized‚Äîonly to later struggle with scale, collaboration, or letting go of control. I‚Äôve also seen 'mis-hires' who‚Äîon paper‚Äîwere "wrong," but they forced tough conversations that made the culture stronger.

Team is your first product, absolutely. But it should be versioned, not venerated.

Seen it. Sharp and true. Culture isn‚Äôt what you write ‚Äî it‚Äôs who you let in early. The first ten shape everything.

It‚Äôs not about team dinners or being visibly polite. If there‚Äôs no real alignment, and people feel suppressed, it‚Äôs just theatre. Better to be respectful, competitive, open ‚Äî and let the leader take the call that‚Äôs best for the firm.

Headline: EA to Director at Deepa Jewellers Limited I Ex EA to MD at CBS Hub Pvt Ltd I Wondersoft l Neeman‚Äôs l Accenture l Karvy Computershare Pvt Ltd l Bank Of America l Jain Irrigation Systems Ltd
Comment: Rightly said Rishabh Mariwala Sir. I completely agree with your thoughts. Luckily I have been through that phase in my Career. First set of employees would believe in the brands vision blindly and trust founders for their long term substantial growth. They contribute to various business requirements as per the need of an hour and drive things by taking ownership unconditionally. But, as an organisation or owning decision making at their end one should always think about justice being done for the contributions made with lesser support on the infrastructure front without any cushioning of statutory compliances in the initial days or couple of years. Later when new hires join, for them red carpet is laid out with the proper infra but their demands would be very high and non negotiable. At the end what it matters for the business? On Ground Contribution, Growth and Building a Brand. Till the time every individual at work understands this and drives the things on his own right Culture wouldn't come into existence. Many won't understand "Team is their first product" or I would call it Lifeline or " Line of Defence" to take the business in the right direction.
